title: Optimize CI binary compilation time
description:
Investigate and implement CI optimizations for Tauri build:

Quick wins identified:
1. Add .cargo/config.toml with thin LTO and codegen-units
2. Add sccache for cross-run compilation caching
3. Split macOS universal binary into parallel arch jobs
4. Optimize Swatinem/rust-cache configuration

Estimated savings: 30-50% on incremental builds

title: Redesign authentication flow UX
description:
Current login/signup flow has UX and security issues that need addressing:

## Problems
- 'User already exists' message is a dead end - no guidance to sign in or reset password
- User enumeration vulnerability (reveals which emails are registered)
- Flow doesn't guide users smoothly between signup/signin/forgot-password

## Proposed improvements
- Replace 'User already exists. Use another email.' with actionable message: 'This email is already registered. [Sign in] or [Reset password]'
- Consider security-first approach: generic 'We've sent you an email' message that handles both new and existing accounts gracefully
- Review entire auth flow for similar UX gaps
- Add rate limiting to prevent enumeration attacks

## Scope
- Signup flow
- Login flow  
- Forgot password flow
- Error messages and user guidance throughout

title: Generate Tauri update signing keypair and add to GitHub secrets
description:
Generate Tauri signing keypair for update verification:
1. Run: pnpm tauri signer generate -w ~/.tauri/nebula.key
2. Store private key securely (backup!)
3. Add to GitHub secrets:
   - TAURI_SIGNING_PRIVATE_KEY
   - TAURI_SIGNING_PRIVATE_KEY_PASSWORD
4. Embed public key in tauri.conf.json updater config

This is separate from Apple code signing - it's for the app to verify updates are authentic.

description:
Follow-up to NEBULA-0v4. Configure Prometheus to scrape:

- Temporal Worker (:9464/metrics) - requires Runtime.install() with telemetryOptions
- Convex function instrumentation via structured JSON logs to Loki (no native Prometheus)

Worker changes needed:
- Import Runtime from @temporalio/worker  
- Call Runtime.install({ telemetryOptions: { metrics: { prometheus: { bindAddress: '0.0.0.0:9464' } } } })
- Add port 9464 to k8s service
